title: How Many Calories in Cheesecake?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in cheesecake per slice, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition details for easy tracking.
assumptions: Standard slice of New York-style cheesecake (about 100g), plain with graham cracker crust, no fruit or whipped cream toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, crust type, and added ingredients. Check labels or recipes for precise values.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of cheesecake contains about 350 calories and 6g protein.

label_note: Values mirror standard Nutrition Facts labels for straightforward comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of cheesecake?
faqs.a: Approximately 350 kcal for a standard 100g slice.

faqs.q: What are the macros in cheesecake?
faqs.a: Per slice: 30g carbs, 6g protein, 24g fat (12g saturated).
Yes, about 20g sugars per slice from cream cheese and crust.

faqs.q: How does cheesecake compare to other desserts?
faqs.a: Higher in fat and calories than fruit-based options but provides some protein.

faqs.q: Can I reduce calories in cheesecake?
faqs.a: Opt for low-fat versions or skip the crust to cut 70-100 kcal per slice.
